turns.speaker: user

turns.speaker: agent

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's Jane Doe, and my date of birth is January 15th, 1988. Is she even taking new patients right now? Last time I called, they said she was booked solid.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you, Jane. Let me check Dr. Ramirez's availability. One moment, please... Okay, it appears Dr. Ramirez is accepting new patients. The first available appointment is on October 27th at 2:00 PM. Does that work for you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: October 27th? That's so far away! Is there absolutely anything sooner, even if it's just a quick check-up slot? I've been having these headaches, and I'm a little worried.

Alternatively, would you be open to seeing Dr. Lee? She's also accepting new patients and has availability next week.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: October 12th at 9:00 AM works! I'd much rather see Dr. Ramirez. Great, let's book that. But, out of curiosity, why is it so hard to get appointments? Is her patient load unusually high, or is the office understaffed?
